title: Fort Smith National Historic Site: Federal Court (1872-1896)
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Stories     Federal Court (1872-1896)                 Stories from the Federal Court Era         Detail of Courtroom Sketch Collection of Fort Smith NHS  The heroic deeds of Fort Smith's deputy marshals and the heinous crimes of outlaws in the Indian Territory have provided inspiration for numerous novels and movies. But, the true stories of the men and women associated with the Federal Court for the Western District of Arkansas at Fort Smith are just as fascinating as the fictional depictions.  Also check out: People of the Federal Court Era Federal Court Era Places
